basic_information.scholarship_notes: Eligible for full disbursement if graduating in December

description: Scholarship Mission: To provide scholarship assistance to students within the College of Education & Professional Studies who are pursuing a degree in Education, School Counseling, or School Psychology. *Preference will be given to graduate student applicants who intend to or currently serve in rural public school districts of Oklahoma. Eligibility Requirements Preference will be given to graduate student applicants who intend to or currently serve in rural public-school districts of Oklahoma Student pursuing a degree in Education, School Counseling, or School Psychology GPA of 2.75 or higher In a short essay, please share your goal and plan of working in rural Oklahoma school districts after graduation Selection Process Recipients of the scholarship will be selected by a departmental committee Award Requirements Must be enrolled in the upcoming fall and spring semester to receive award Attendance at an awards banquet is required for all recipients Recipients must write a thank you letter to the donors of the scholarship
